ns2:member.ns1:desc: No action is in progress.
Downloading of files (load modules) in progress.
Saving a Configuration Version.
Reconfiguring MOs according to the UCF.
Executing trigger Initiate.
Executing trigger Preload.
Executing trigger Convert.
Executing an application unique trigger.
The node is to be restarted, for example, due to rollback at failure, or as a normal action in the upgrade sequence.
Executing trigger Execute.
Executing trigger Finish.
The execution mode is switched back to normal.
Execution of an install or an upgrade action has failed.
Cancellation of an ongoing installation is in progress.
Execution of the cancelInstall action failed.
The verification phase has been initiated.
Verifying that the upgrade Window defined in the UCF allows an upgrade.
Verifying that it is possible to create the required number of CVs during the upgrade phase.
Verifying that the used plug-in-units in the node are supported according to the UCF.
Verifying the checksum for all load modules that has a checksum value defined in the UCF.
Verifying that plug-in-units on the node are not faulty before the upgrade is initiated.
The verification phase is finished.
The verification phase has failed.
The JVM is to be restarted.
The execution mode is switched to upgrade.
One or several plug-in-units are to be upgraded.
A number of programs are started, stopped or upgraded.
One or several programs are added and/or removed.
Node upgrade requested.
Executing trigger Confirmed.
Handling of final configuration version failed, for example, creation, setting as startable.
Waiting for confirmation of the upgrade.
Upgrade has been executed successfully.
Variant of upgrade action initiated (that is, update, upgrade or rebootNodeUpgrade).
Progress indication from an AUE that is part of the upgrade.
An AUE has reported failure or has not answered within an expected time.
An AUE has confirmed with warning.
Verifying that initial configured PIUs (with programs) are supported by the Upgrade Package (in UCF) and that all load modules referenced in programs are valid.
Verifying that the JVM MP(s) is operational.
Verifying the Fault Tolerant Core (FTC) states.
Verifying that all required load module files are installed for the supported plug-in-units according to the UCF.
Verifying that the subracks in the node are supported according to the UCF.
Verifying that SwAllocations connected to the same slot do not define the same PiuType.
Verifying that Slots related to plug-in-units are connected to an SWA.

Verifying that only allowed types of load modules are referenced in Repertoires to be connected to ManagedObject(s) via an SWA.
Both configured data and data in the UCF will be used to predict the SwAllocation connections during upgrade.
Verifying that all Repertoires in a SwAllocation support the same set of PiuTypes.

Verifying that programs that will exist in TO state are specified in a consistent manner, that is the result of combining UCF data with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU must be consistent. The following checks are done:
- heap value - pool value - program instances - loader data (attributes loader type, deviceLoaderName) - device loader information - loader type allowed for program parent MO
Shrink has been executed successfully.
Execution of shrink has been initiated.
Identifying not required load module files.
Removing not required load module files.
Read of referring CV information initiated
